df-line2
blocks.content: Define the ` Line ` function. This function generates the line passing through the distinct points ` a ` and ` b ` . Adapted from definition 6.14 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 25-Oct-2013.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-line2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cline2, coprab(s0, s1, s2, wrex(s3, cn, wa(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s2), cec(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), ccnv(ccolin)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-ray
blocks.content: Define the ` Ray ` function. This function generates the set of all points that lie on the ray starting at ` p ` and passing through ` a ` . Definition 6.8 of [Schwabhauser] p. 44. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Oct-2013.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-ray(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cray, coprab(s0, s1, s2, wrex(s3, cn, wa(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s2), crab(s4, cfv(cee, cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s0), coutsideof, cop(cv(s1), cv(s4)))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-ray(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ Ray = { < < s0, s1 >, s2 > | ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà ‚Ñï,((s0 ‚àà(EE ` s3)‚àß s1 ‚àà(EE ` s3)‚àß s0 ‚â† s1)‚àß s2 = { s4 ‚àà(EE ` s3)| s0[OutsideOf]< s1, s4 > }))}
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
}

blocks.name: funline
blocks.content: Show that the ` Line ` relationship is a function. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 25-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)

thm funline() {
  |- wfun(cline2)

blocks.name: linedegen
blocks.content: When ` Line ` is applied with the same argument, the result is the empty set. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)

thm fvline(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wceq(co(c1, cline2, c2), cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)

blocks.name: liness
blocks.content: A line is a subset of the space its two points lie in. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 25-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm liness(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wss(co(c1, cline2, c2), cfv(cee, c0)))
} = {
  eqsstrd(co(c1, cline2, c2), cfv(cee, c0), cab(hs0, wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
  fvline(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  abssdv(hs0, cfv(cee, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0))), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0))))
  3jca(w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)))
  a1i(w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  simp1(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))
  simp2(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))
  colineardim1(c0, cv(hs0), universe, c1, c2, cfv(cee, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cee, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
}

thm fvline2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wceq(co(c1, cline2, c2), crab(s0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl6eqr(co(c1, cline2, c2), crab(s0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cin(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
  eqtr4d(co(c1, cline2, c2), cin(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0)), cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wceq(cin(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0)), cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))), wss(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0)))
  eqsstr3d(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0), co(c1, cline2, c2), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
  fvline(s0, c0, c1, c2)
  liness(c0, c1, c2)
  df-ss(cab(s0, wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), cfv(cee, c0))
  dfrab2(s0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(s0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cee, c0)
  diff.cee.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: lineunray
blocks.content: A line is composed of a point and the two rays emerging from it. Theorem 6.15 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 26-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm lineunray(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cee, c0))), wa(wne(c1, c2), wne(c1, c3))), wi(wbr(c1, cbtwn, cop(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c1, cline2, c2), cun(cun(co(c1, cray, c2), csn(c1)), co(c1, cray, c3)))))

thm linerflx1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wcel(c1, co(c1, cline2, c2)))
} = {
  eleqtrrd(c1, co(c1, cline2, c2), crab(hs0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))))
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wcel(c1, crab(hs0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wbr(c1, ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  simpr1(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))
  3adant3r3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2), wbr(c1, ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  colineartriv1(c0, c1, c2)
  elrab(hs0, c1, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)), wbr(c1, ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, ccolin, cop(c1, c2))
  fvline2(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cee, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c1, ccolin, cop(c1, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

thm linecom(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  rabbidva(hs0, cfv(cee, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2))), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c2, c1)))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0)), wb(wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c2, c1))))
  syl13anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0))), wb(wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c1, c2)), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c2, c1))), wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0)))
  simp3(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cee, c0)))

  colinearperm1(c0, cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  fvline2(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  sylan2b(wcel(c0, cn), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cline2, c1), crab(hs0, cfv(cee, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), ccolin, cop(c2, c1)))), w3a(wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c2, c1)))
  bitri(w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), w3a(wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c2, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c2, c1)))
  3anbi3i(wcel(c1, cfv(cee, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(cee, c0)), wne(c1, c2), wne(c2, c1))
  necom(c1, c2)

thm ellines(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, clines2), wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(c0, clines2), wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, clines2)
  rexlimivv(s0, s1, cn, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  a1i(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cee, cv(s0)))), wi(wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))), wcel(c0, universe)))
  rexlimivw(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  adantl(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpbiri(wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2)), universe))
  ovex(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))
  eleq1(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2)), universe)
  vtoclbg(hs0, c0, universe, wcel(c0, clines2), wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(c0, co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))))), wcel(cv(hs0), clines2), wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cee, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(s1), cline2, cv(s2))))))))

blocks.name: linethru
blocks.content: If ` A ` is a line containing two distinct points ` P ` and ` Q ` , then ` A ` is the line through ` P ` and ` Q ` . Theorem 6.18 of [Schwabhauser] p. 45. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 28-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm linethru(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, clines2), wa(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wceq(c0, co(c1, cline2, c2)))

thm hilbert1.2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

blocks.name: linethrueu
blocks.content: There is a unique line going through any two distinct points. Theorem 6.19 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)

blocks.name: lineintmo
blocks.content: Two distinct lines intersect in at most one point. Theorem 6.21 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
